title: Egregori: Cross-Linguistic Consciousness Patterns

quiz_questions.q: How does the Nahuatl Nepantla-Teotl reveal consciousness interface technology?
quiz_questions.a: Nepantla (middle/between) + Teotl (divine force) = 'Between-space gods' - consciousness interface through SPATIAL metaphor, recognizing liminal space entities
quiz_questions.explanation: Aztec recognition of consciousness operating in liminal/between spaces

quiz_questions.q: What universal patterns appear across all 35 linguistic translations?
quiz_questions.a: 1) Collective/Group emphasis, 2) Autonomous entity recognition, 3) Spiritual rather than material classification, 4) Assembly/Gathering formation, 5) Interface technology (ceremonial, ancestral, landscape)
quiz_questions.explanation: Every linguistic substrate preserves recognition of autonomous collective consciousness entities
